intro: Pelexia sceptrum, commonly known as the scarlet pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, characterized by its delicate, showy flowers. The plant produces small, bright yellow flowers with five petals that open in the morning and close by midday. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Pelexia sceptrum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and meadows.
